New Records: Rhys Hoskins hit his fifth career grand slam and third this season
Key Match Events: Sean Manaea lasted only 3 ²/₃ innings and surrendered six runs, one unearned, on seven hits and two walks with one strikeout
Francisco Lindor committed a throwing error that led to an unearned run
Rhys Hoskins socked a grand slam in the first inning to give the Brewers a 4-0 lead
Mark Vientos hit a two-run homer in the third against Frankie Montas
Francisco Alvarez walked leading off the third inning before Vientos hit a two-run homer
Garrett Mitchell stole second in the Brewers’ win over the Mets
Turang reached third on a passed ball and scored on a wild pitch in the sixth
Gary Sanchez launched a solo homer against Alex Young in the bottom of the eighth to give the Brewers an 8-4 lead
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets still have everything at stake in the regular season and the Brewers nothing, but you wouldn’t have known it by Friday’s game
Post-Match Reflections: “They outplayed us today,” Lindor said. “They scored, ran the bases better than we did and they hit with runners in scoring position.”
“It sucks,” Manaea said. “We’re fighting for our lives over here and to do that, it doesn’t feel good, but we are resilient.”
“I was very pleased with [our] at-bats and they kept fighting,” Mendoza said. “We didn’t give up.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets were flat in all regards for a second straight game
The Padres clinched the top wild-card seed Friday
Francisco Lindor returned to the lineup after missing the previous eight games with lower back tightness and reached base three times
The Brewers, locked into a No. 3 seed for the postseason, weren’t content to take a passive approach and went 6-for-6 in stolen base attempts
The Mets sliced their deficit to 5-2 on Mark Vientos’ two-run homer in the third against Frankie Montas
Others: Carlos Mendoza was ejected for protesting a called third strike on Francisco Alvarez in the fourth inning
Alvarez grabbed for his lower back after sliding into third base in the seventh inning and had to depart
Alvarez was diagnosed with back spasms
